intro: Knorringia pamirica, commonly known as the Pamir knorringia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of white, pink, and purple. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Knorringia pamirica is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
